structuredData.name: Flux.2 Flex
structuredData.description: A versatile AI model by Black Forest Labs that allows users to adjust inference steps (e.g., 4 to 50) to trade off between generation speed/cost and image fidelity.

hero.title: Flux.2 Flex: The First Elastic AI Model
hero.tagline: Replaces the rigid 'Schnell' model. Dial down to 4 steps for lightning-fast drafts, or crank it up to 50 steps for final polish. You control the compute.

imageGallery.title: Flux.2 Flex: From Draft to Masterpiece
imageGallery.description: Explore the spectrum of speed and quality. See examples ranging from rapid 4-step prototypes to polished 50-step renders, demonstrating the model's incredible versatility.

how_to.title: Prototype Fast, Polish Later
how_to.description: Optimized for workflow efficiency. Save credits on drafts, spend them on finals.

steps.title: 1. Select Flux.2 Flex

useCases.title: Versatility in Action
useCases.description: Flux.2 Flex solves the dilemma of 'Fast vs Good' by giving you both options in one tool.

scenarios.description: Social media managers use Flux.2 Flex at 10-15 steps to generate high-quality visuals for Twitter and Instagram posts. It's fast enough to react to trends in real-time but looks better than standard turbo models.

image.alt: A trendy, colorful image for an Instagram story generated in seconds.

scenarios.description: Concept artists set the model to 4 steps to rapidly generate dozens of compositional sketches. Once they like a layout, they switch to high steps to render the final details, saving massive amounts of waiting time.

image.alt: A grid of 9 rapid compositional sketches for a movie poster.

scenarios.description: Bloggers use the mid-range setting (20 steps) to create featured images that look professional but don't burn through their monthly credit allowance. It's the sweet spot for web content.

image.alt: A clean, illustrated blog header image about technology.

scenarios.description: Directors use the low-step mode to visualize camera angles and lighting setups for scripts. The speed allows them to storyboard an entire scene during a lunch break.

image.alt: A sequence of black and white storyboard frames.

features.title: Why Flex is the Smart Choice
features.description: The only model that adapts to your needs, from speed-demon to quality-king.

items.title: Adjustable Step Count
items.description: Unique to Flex. Run at 4 steps for 'Schnell-like' speed, or 50 steps for 'Pro-like' quality. You control the compute and the credit cost.

items.title: Solid Typography
items.description: Even at lower steps, Flux.2 Flex retains the core Flux ability to render text. It's perfect for quick memes or presentation slides.

items.title: Low Latency
items.description: At its lowest settings, Flex generates images in under a second. This 'real-time' feel is transformative for iterative creative sessions.

items.title: Credit Efficient
items.description: Why pay full price for a draft? Flex allows you to spend fewer credits on iterations and only pay for the final high-step render.

items.title: Great Composition
items.description: It inherits the 32B parameter knowledge base, so even at low steps, the composition and anatomy remain surprisingly coherent compared to other turbo models.

items.title: Guidance Tuning
items.description: Unlike the previous 'Schnell' model which had fixed guidance, Flex allows you to tweak how closely the AI adheres to your prompt.

items.question: Does Flux.2 Flex replace Flux Schnell?
items.answer: Yes. Flux.2 Flex is the evolution of Schnell. It offers the same high speed capabilities but adds the flexibility to increase quality when needed, making it a more versatile tool.

items.question: How does the 'Steps' slider affect my cost?
items.answer: On z-image.app, utilizing lower steps (4-10) consumes fewer credits because it uses less GPU time. Higher steps (25-50) cost standard rates. Check the pricing panel for exact details.

items.question: Is the quality as good as Pro at high steps?
items.answer: It gets very close! While Flux.2 Pro still holds the edge in 4MP resolution and ultimate texture fidelity, Flux.2 Flex at 50 steps is indistinguishable from Pro for most web and social media uses.

items.question: Can I use Flex for commercial work?
items.answer: Yes, images generated with Flux.2 Flex on our platform come with a commercial license, making it perfect for rapid client work and social media management.

items.question: Does it support the Multi-Reference feature?
items.answer: Flex supports basic image-to-image, but the advanced Multi-Reference consistency is primarily optimized for the Pro and Dev models. Flex is focused on single-image speed.

items.question: Why is my text slightly blurry at low steps?
items.answer: At extremely low steps (4-6), the model hasn't had enough iterations to fully 'converge' the fine details of text. Increasing steps to 15-20 usually fixes this immediately.

items.question: What is the best use case for Flex?
items.answer: It is the best everyday driver. Use it for brainstorming, blog posts, social media, and any task where you need good images fast without burning through your credit allowance.

items.question: Is it better than SDXL Turbo?
items.answer: In our benchmarks, Flux.2 Flex offers significantly better prompt adherence and text rendering than SDXL Turbo, even at similar speeds.
